# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[!,:ym] = map(x -> Int(string(x.year,'0',6))'), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function creates a new column `ym` in the input DataFrame `df`. It uses the `map` function to apply a conversion to each element of the `dt` column. The conversion extracts the year and month from the DateTime, concatenates them together as a string in format "yyyymm", then converts the resulting string to an integer. Finally, the function returns the modified DataFrame.
